bill_title: to revise certain provisions regarding the discharge of certain weapons at game while in or on a motor vehicle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the discharge of certain weapons at game while in or on a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-37 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-37. No person, who is in or on a motor vehicle or any conveyance attached to a motor vehicle which is on a public highway or in a field of unharvested grain or seed crops , may take game or discharge a firearm or bow and arrow at any wild animals except coyotes, rabbits, hares jackrabbits , rodents , and foxes. No person may discharge a firearm or other implement with which a big game animal could be killed from a motor vehicle or any other means of transportation during a time and in a place that big game hunting is permitted. However, licensed Licensed hunters who are paraplegics or otherwise physically unable to walk with or without crutches, braces, or other mechanical support, and who have a disabled hunter permit, may shoot in fields or , woods , or from public roads from a standing stationary motor vehicle while hunting game animals or game birds in accordance with the conditions of the permit and rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 . A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the discharge of certain weapons at game while in or on a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-37 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-37. No person, who is in or on a motor vehicle or any conveyance attached to a motor vehicle which is on a public highway or in a field of unharvested grain or seed crops , may take game or discharge a firearm or bow and arrow at any wild animals except coyotes, rabbits, hares jackrabbits , rodents , skunks, badgers, racoons, and foxes. No person may discharge a firearm or other implement with which a big game animal could be killed from a motor vehicle or any other means of transportation during a time and in a place that big game hunting is permitted. However, licensed Licensed hunters who are paraplegics or otherwise physically unable to walk with or without crutches, braces, or other mechanical support, and who have a disabled hunter permit, may shoot in fields or , woods , or from public roads from a standing stationary motor vehicle while hunting game animals or game birds in accordance with the conditions of the permit and rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 . A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. BILL HISTORY 1/13/98 First read in Senate and referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. S.J. 26 1/20/98 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 1. S.J. 112 1/21/98 Senate Do Pass, Passed, AYES 31, NAYS 1.
